p.s: The 7th scene from the first act of Macbeth by Shakespeare is about Lady Macbeth trying to convince Macbeth to kill the kingKing.
First, Lady Macbeth asked Macbeth why he left the chamber where the King is eating.
Macbeth is about to not continue in their plan killing him and is informing Lady Macbeth over this.
He arguments that the kingKing and other people have shown him their respect lately and he does not want to disrespect them.
Lady Macbeth disagrees and encounters, that he has to do it if he loves her and that he also want to become the king, but he has to do what is necessary to do.
Macbeth shows slight agreement and says if he kills him, there will be no one standing above him.
Lady Macbeth continues and says that when he revealed his plan to kill the kingKing to her, he was a real man.
If he kills the kingKing, he will be even more than a man.
She also says that the kingKing already has thrown away their values and she raises a child for Macbeth and all of it should not be for nothing.
Macbeth thinks about the event of failure, but Lady Macbeth encounters that they do what has to be done and they will not fail anyways.
She also tells him the details about the plan to get his guards drunk and kill the kingKing while he is asleep.
Macbeth now changed his mind, agrees to kill the kingKing and describes his thoughts on it.
Also, he suggests his wife to only give birth to male children.
